Convert 3D coordinates to 3D mesh

Source: R/convert_points_to_mesh.R
convert_points_to_mesh.Rd

Computes alpha-shape of three-dimensional coordinates, see here for more info.

convert_points_to_mesh(point.matrix, alpha, showme = TRUE)

Arguments

point.matrix

Coordinate data as matrix (individual points, x/y/z coordinates)
alpha

See ashape3d
showme

Return default 3D plot

Value

3D mesh

Examples


if (FALSE) data(example_3D_face)

M.mesh <- convert_points_to_mesh(point.matrix = example_3D_face,
alpha = 1.2,
showme = FALSE)

#> Error in alphashape3d::ashape3d(point.matrix, alpha = alpha): object 'example_3D_face' not found

# Show 3D face in R notebook
rgl::open3d()

#> glX 
#>   1 
rgl::plot3d(M.mesh,
     type = "wire", col = "gray",
      box = FALSE, axes = FALSE,
      xlab = "", ylab = "", zlab = "",
      specular = "black")

#> Error in rgl::plot3d(M.mesh, type = "wire", col = "gray", box = FALSE,     axes = FALSE, xlab = "", ylab = "", zlab = "", specular = "black"): object 'M.mesh' not found
rgl::aspect3d("iso")
rgl::rglwidget()
